transportAdvice: Gdańsk has an efficient public transit network of trams and buses that connects the main tourist areas, including the historic Old Town and the seaside district of Sopot. The Old Town itself is very walkable, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with occasional snow or sleet; pack warm layers and waterproofs.
Still cold and wintry with frost likely; snow possible but days begin to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings cool, changeable weather with a mix of sun and cloud.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with occasional showers; a good time to explore the Old Town.
Warm and green with longer days; one of the more comfortable months to visit.
Warm summer weather sets in with occasional thunderstorms; beaches begin to attract visitors.
The warmest month with long sunny days; peak beach season along the Baltic coast.
Warm and busy with summer crowds; good conditions for outdoor sightseeing and the beach.
Early autumn brings cooler, quieter conditions with pleasant temperatures for walking.
Noticeably cooler and wetter; foliage turns golden but rain gear is advisable.
Cold and often overcast with frequent rain; a quiet, off-season atmosphere in the city.
Cold and festive with Christmas markets in the Old Town; snow is possible but not guaranteed.
